title: The Token Compensation Paradox: Losing Reputation To Earn Money.
body:
***This piece was written in collaboration with [Eliot Couvat](https://twitter.com/CDTEliot) to expand upon the thoughts we shared on “[De-Financializing Social Tokens](https://kairon.mirror.xyz/O_yvXUWh73LtfEJ3AdUQtZEPFK8dPp5Zmynf9qx-uYc)”, we figured now more than ever would be the best time to get this conversation started in tokenized communities and DAOs. If you’d like to check out Eliot’s amazing writing on Social Tokens [make sure to follow him on Substack!](https://eliotc.substack.com/)***


---

Many people took the leap into Web3 and started contributing to DAOs because of the excitement of being paid in tokens.

That’s because, unlike traditional salaries, tokens offered them almost unlimited upside (similar to equities), and contributors could earn a lot without bringing upfront capital.

But, continuing their journey and becoming increasingly involved in several projects, more contributors realized their tokens also provided them ownership, a voice over future strategic decisions, and unlocked new perks in specific communities.

And, after some time, many contributors found themselves stuck with their tokens, wanting to take profit, and make a living salary, but not at the expense of their voice and their reputation.

[https://twitter.com/samspurlin/status/1525613447240634371](https://twitter.com/samspurlin/status/1525613447240634371)

So how do we solve this Token Compensation Paradox that’s blocking DAOs and contributors from scaling and moving towards new horizons? Well, if we want to address the problem in-depth and re-think an entire compensation model used by thousands of DAOs, first we need to understand the underlying issues that come with the current situation.

## 1 - Beyond The Reputation Problem

The contributor compensation problem goes well beyond the simple struggle of sacrificing your reputation to make a livable salary.

With the compensation model we've built, we're heading toward wider inequalities within DAOs, more social pressure for contributors, and an ever increasing amount of DAOs failing due to this unsustainable model.

Indeed, if we want to pride ourselves in building new organizations, reinventing governance and political models; it's essential to separate voice from pay - otherwise, we're just building pure oligarchies and exacerbating inequality.

To illustrate how this model could eventually backfire on DAOs, here’s a real world example of what happens when you tie a person’s bags with their political power: Sweden used a financially weighted voting system until 1910, the number of votes that one could have was proportional to their wealth. This resulted in a couple of individuals having more than half the votes in several dozen municipalities - almost like perfectly legal dictators.

[https://twitter.com/fkpxls/status/1531306137856909312](https://twitter.com/fkpxls/status/1531306137856909312)

For DAOs to [compete with traditional companies](https://eliotc.substack.com/p/working-for-a-dao-how-thousands-of), we should do away with the social pressure that comes with selling tokens. No contributor should have to "short" the DAO and go against their beliefs to pay the bills; nor should they harm or quit a community they believe in, simply because they can't afford to keep their tokens. And the problem goes even further; because the incentives are not aligned, the current compensation scenario can even make the most active contributors hurt the community, their regular sales negatively impacting the token's price and harming the decentralization potential of decision making. All of this, mind you, within the confines of the community they value most.

Your most fervent believers shouldn’t be getting paid exclusively in the same type of virtual currency they use on a day to day basis to make decisions, grow their reputation, and push the DAO forward. By tying their payout to your DAO’s native token, you’re sacrificing the diversity of opinions you aim to nurture, and harming your project as a whole.

If we want to create new compensation models, we must rethink them from the ground up and align incentives between the DAO growth and contributors.

So how do we do that?

## 2 - Betting On The Long Term

Quite a few obvious ideas come to mind, and some have even been tested out. A handful of people argue that DAOs should pay salaries with Social tokens and use NFTs for reputation. Others have suggested paying contributors only in USDC, or creating two tokens, one for governance and the other as a source of liquidity.

While all those solutions seem promising, implementing or defining any of them as the de facto compensation model for DAOs would be missing the big picture.

Social tokens are much more liquid than NFTs, and allow communities to reward their contributors in a much more streamlined manner. They work particularly well as a reputation system and engage contributors towards exploring everything your community has to offer. Using them simply as a way to compensate contributors would simply kill their utility and their reason to exist. There's no such thing as an NFT that generates continuous engagement and rewards your daily contributors' loyalty.

As the Music NFT's artist [Xcelencia](https://twitter.com/Xcelencia) mentioned [in an interview](https://learn.trybonfire.xyz/case-studies-interviews/interview-with-xcelencia-equis-1) talking about the way he manages his community:

> *"I see social tokens as this continuous engagement. I treat it as a sort of loyalty or rewards program where I can keep everyone in and have them contribute in new and different ways.*
>
> *Whereas I see NFTs as these 'big moments' or highlights, the things you really want to commemorate like a great song, you want to put it out as an NFT. It's a different type of engagement."*

**Dissociating social tokens from reputation would kill your contributors' engagement, and so would paying them only in USDC.**

Paying contributors in USDC would mean firstly not sharing ownership (a core principle of DAOs), and secondly, forgetting that most DAOs usually don't have a financially liquid treasury beyond their tokens. Tokens are a great way to share "future" upside and recognize the effort of early contributors.

Paying contributors in USDC and providing governance tokens to decentralized decisions would surely solve the problem in the short term, but it would also end up nurturing a community without any values beyond the next paycheck.

**Something very similar would happen if you choose to create two tokens - one for salary and one for governance.**

While some may believe this solves the liquidity problem while retaining the "real" token's intrinsic value, what you're really doing is cutting your community's potential in half by distracting your message and limiting the true capabilities of tokenization.

Besides, the value offered by governance, access, and reputation can be incentive enough in some cases, just not in an everyday scenario for your average contributor. It's not unheard of to see social tokens being sold in "black markets" of sorts for non-negligible prices based on the value they offer alone. So, in the end, the 2nd token would need liquidity anyway, and the problem would still be the same.

All of those failed experiments showed us one thing. We have to see past our shared baggage of Web2 compensation models, where the main way to get compensated is to get a salary once a task is done. Web3 technologies are offering us new ways to share the value created while attributing the merit to the right people, and we must seize this opportunity to build better coordination models and organizations.

## 3 - It’s Time To Come Up With Revolutionary Ideas

Sure, *“We’rE So EarLy”* - and there might not be any clear-cut solutions to contributor compensation yet. But we are optimists, and there are so many experiments we could run.

What about exploring ways to fix this token compensation paradox from a protocol-side. There are so many Web3 native solutions and mechanics which would enable a more fair distribution of funds without compromising a social token’s in-built utility, governance, or compliance with securities’ laws. Think about mechanics such as staking, delegation of governance power based on merit, and emission curves. In DAOs with diversified treasuries, we could also envision contributors hand-picking their desired mix of stablecoins (or any token in the treasury) and the DAO token for compensation through customizable smart contracts. In the beginning, contributors would want more stability (90-10 mix), but as they entrench themselves in your community, the more they would tip the scales towards reputation (50-50).

Finally, another interesting solution has recently popped into the scene: tying your reputation to soul-bound tokens and on-chain credentials. While our platforms still have a long way to go in terms of security and actual use-cases for this type of tokens, the promise is there for a non-speculative asset that serves the only purpose of being your web3 ticket to access based on merit. By properly leveraging Soulbound Tokens and offering enough flexibility in their properties, communities could have the key to proper liquidity through their tokens, without compromising their contributor’s reputation, or the DAO’s treasury.

We can play around with the formulae for due recognition of work however we please, even involving systems that may or may not pay people **before** they complete a certain task based on their already accrued merit. We need only look at the chain, social tokens, NFTs, and all of the other tools we have at our disposal to make this process human-centric and token-enabled.

## Closing thoughts

We really are just scratching the surface in how we approach the future of work.

Web3 projects are very different beasts to your average Silicon Valley startup. In order to find a way to compensate the people making all of this happen, we could explore the seasonality of DAOs, our product cycles and monetization. There’s so much to experiment with when it comes to people’s relationship to impact, legacy and the future they want to see. Not everything needs to be a discord server and some Snapshot proposals.

***The answer to the token compensation paradox resides in keeping tokens in the equation while disconnecting them from financial value.***

If we want contributors to get credit for their work, and social tokens to reach their non-financial heights, we have to leverage the social tokens’ true power and stop looking for use cases where they might not shine their brightest.

title: Designing a task creation flow for a task manager
body:
## Intro

Delightree is a SAAS company which focus was to automate Standard Operation Procedures) SOP for franchises - they have pivoted since I left the company.

I joined the company when they had just got funding based on an MVP, and my task was to re-design the interface to make it a sellable product.

![Home: before & after](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4Scd8o1WnLcTp-hKk7r5h.png?height=900&width=1600&size=medium)

One of the hypothesis the product manager wanted to validate was that tasks would be created by store managers, which were part of the Deskless Workforce. Hence, they needed a way to create a task for their team.

## Discovery

As part of the discovery process we had client interviews and input from the Customer Success team. Based on it, we created a list of requirements we needed to fulfill when creating a task:

1. A title for the task
2. A description for the task
3. Any attachments that were relevant for the assignee to complete the task
4. There were 2 modes
   1. Simple task
   2. Task with To-dos
5. Had to be scheduled for a specific day
   1. Could have a specific completion time
   2. Could be a one time task
   3. Could be a repetitive task
      1. Repetitive tasks had a set of different variations
6. Had to be assigned to different people
   1. Could be assigned to individuals
   2. Could be assigned to the whole store

![Initial design for the task creation flow](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_6YXJqNlndKYV5hvyBJro.png?height=900&width=1600&size=medium)

## Decisions

As it was a lot of information, we decided to break the creation into a step by step flow that reduced the cognitive noise and help them focus on the task at hand. It ended up being divided into a 4 section flow.

![Step by step process for the task creation flow](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LrZhTccgYeAMLUunI7bDw.png?height=900&width=1600&size=medium)

### Details

The details section grouped everything that was related with the information the Assignee needed to know in order to be able to complete the task:

* Title
* Description
* Attachments

![Task details](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o0u6bmedomK1yPmTw0fVr.png?height=900&width=1600&size=medium)

### To dos

During the validation process we realised there were 2 main type of tasks: The ones that were a simple confirmation task (I’ve made it), while other required more actions. The actions that we identified during our research were:

* Checklist (sub-tasks)
* Take a picture
* Attach a file
* Write something
* Multiple choice
* Rating

Based on this, the second part of the flow was focused on helping the user choose what type of task to create.

![Different options to select the type of to-do to add to the task (or not)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uA6K8KC82sN8ojkLVF1mS.png?height=900&width=1620&size=medium)

### Schedule

Also as part of our research and the data we had from the platform, we realised users created more repeating tasks than one time ones. That’s why we made this the default option. Also, we added the “Advanced settings” feature, which gave the users the flexibility to schedule their tasks with very complex settings while keeping it simple at first sight.

![Different options for scheduling a task](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/y8b40fy7ArOeGE_pQDxG4.png?height=900&width=1600&size=medium)

### Assign

The last step of the flow was who to assign the task to. Users had the option to assign the task to a whole location where just 1 person from that location could complete it (Close the store, for example) and it’d be completed for everyone who belong to that store, or to a specific individual. We referenced Whatsapp and Facebook’s way of doing this in mobile, and mixed it with our specific needs.

![Different states for the task assign step](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zITH2QQydiAZmlZoXJwm0.png?height=900&width=1600&size=medium)

## Conclusion

![All steps of the process](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4TVUut97y-mHcVgEUV2f-.png?height=900&width=1620&size=medium)

In the end, we came up with a flow that took users smoothly through the whole task creation process, assuring them they were doing that they wanted to do and guiding them all the time. This had a high rate of acceptance and rose task creation metrics, which made it a successful project.

title: What Are Gamefied NFTs & Why Do They Matter In The Metaverse?
body:
**Introduction to the "meta:verses”**

The Metaverse according to me are interactive & immersive extensions of the Internet, that will be defined & differentiated by the "game:fied" mechanisms behind them. I prefer to call it meta:verses as I believe that, just like the "websites of the internet", "galaxies/planets of the universe", the metaverse is going to be based on 'verses' that will have different functions/mechanisms & use cases.

Gamefied NFTs: AKA “Artistic Arcade Metaverses”, a concept derived/coined by me as an indie game dev & an amateur generative artist which involves "crafting imaginary AI play into art pieces blended with interactive arcade inspired by classic retros or hyper-casual games that will be built & hosted alongside dynamic mechanisms on the blockchain" & just like single pages of the web, these are simple/single or non-fungible verses of the metaverse.

As the NFT community evolves: we see different forms of creations, scaling from 1/1 arts to PFPs, from music NFTs to photography & a lot more; but the concept of having NFTs as games might seem new but will be understandable by a lot of people if exposed & will help create a fun filled community as challenges could be created by individuals or teams as I call it; a league of "non-fungible gamers" & unlike casual NFTs, these will be multiple editions based or ERC1155 because they are meant to be played by 'people'.

The concept of gamefied NFTs is both exclusive & inclusive, as all games are hosted on multiple servers like IPFS or itch.io, and these will provide links alongside these crafts that makes it shareable by exclusive owners to non-owners to make it inclusive unlike other NFTs. With these, a lot of indie game devs will be able to hop into the NFT scene as a whole new community of creatives, presently we see a lot of passionate indie game devs running down the drain or struggling to be recognized, as they are not given actual opportunities to expose their cranky creations because big game studios are dominating the scene, but with decentralization & the rise of gamefied NFTs, they'd be able to create exclusive games for the community & with that keep the passion alive. And these way game lovers who would like to play or replay some of these classics are given an opportunity.

In the blockchain: These could also be used as a medium of token creation, using the $ASH ecosystem & mechanism as an example which Pak tagged "a token of creation through destruction" where art pieces released under the ecosystem can be directly burned & used to create new tokens which are directly distributed to the owners/burners as a reward unlike the actual burning system across blockchains. This I site as the second phase of my crafts that I tagged "Gamefied Fungibility & Interoperability" this is the part where all gamefied NFTs are merged & can be achieved by either creating an AI blockchain protocol or actual AI blockchain that will power these creations; For (1) Fungibility: Just like $ASH, thousands/millions of gamefied NFTs built by creative devs will be directly burned by owners after playing, as a decentralized means of mining new fungible/social tokens & in return acts as a reward for playing, more like a little 'Play2Earn' games. This will be valued & dynamically balanced by the AI system & by the community using it. This will also serve as a medium of ‘burning’ NFTs & earn an arcade game as a reward… For (2) Interoperability: With an AI system that has the ability to communicate with multi-chains, interoperable transactions will be carried out with a little fee, moving NFTs from one chain to the other will be made easy and will also trigger the minting of new gamefied NFTs to the wallet of the person who carries out this transaction.

In the actual immersive metaverse: gamefied NFTs will become gem-like collectible mini-games, having read/watched things like "ready player one" where we see many mini games coming into play as a form of quest or just a fun play & some actually involving the authors of the OASIS, we could state an example to say to access a certain weapon you must complete this mini game,

or just function as a sort of collectible to boast of like pokemon cards but played in a 2d virtual screen built within these 3d immersive worlds. We could have thousands of it placed across different part of "meta:verses" as actual arcade machines but will be more artistic as against the "retro times" where coins were inserted to play but here crypto(s) will be inserted to access these.

“The metaverse” just like I stated earlier wouldn't be just immersive worlds, as we are already seeing mechanisms that will be super important in the metaverse, why others are waiting for a single immersive 3D MMORPG as a metaverse, the mechanisms are being put into play, like Pak's "merge/mass" this I believe is an actual metaverse of mechanism that is "play/game" based. Then the metaverse/meta:verses will be gradually scaled to virtual worlds of fantasies, stories, or just fun based immersive extensions of the internet.

Let's build the metaverse bit by bit: "one verse at a time"!

title: #1 La révolution NFTs dans la musique ?
body:
Hello à toutes et à tous,

C’est une véritable révolution qui se déroule en ce moment même avec la **blockchain** et la tornade **NFT**.

Et cette dernière passe actuellement pile-poil au-dessus de nos têtes de musiciens !

Il est vrai qu’il est difficile pour une grande partie d’entre nous de comprendre comment une simple image que l’on peut dupliquer en un clic puisse valoir d’un coup plusieurs milliers de dollars !

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_U8GLdlMYQNj3Pvo-6yZY.webp?height=140&width=250)

Mais il faut bien comprendre qu’en utilisant la blockchain pour garantir le côté unique et indivisible d’une œuvre, on a redonné de la valeur à des objets numériques qui n’en avaient plus !

C’est un changement considérable qui a lieu et qui permet non seulement de redonner de la valeur à des œuvres numériques, mais également de redonner aux artistes la propriété de leur travail ainsi qu’une véritable indépendance.

Le NFT étant bien plus qu’un simple fichier numérique, que ce soit une image ou un fichier audio, mais qui doit être perçu plutôt comme l’équivalent d’une action (votre musique) que mettrait à disposition une société à ses actionnaires (vos fans).

**Ces derniers auraient alors dans leurs mains une fraction de votre marque/musique et cette dernière pourrait prendre de la valeur au rythme de votre vie artistique.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vB5bRbopy8iZrb_a50Z0J.webp?height=400&width=480)

Cette notion de propriété retrouvée touche donc chacun d’entre nous et pour une fois, depuis longtemps, c’est nous qui décidons de notre valeur.

En effet, jusqu’à présent, c’était les majors, les labels, les magasins de disques et enfin les plateformes de streams, qui définissaient la valeur de notre musique. Ils avaient presque réussi à nous convaincre qu’elle n’en avait quasiment plus.

Avec les NFTS nous reprenons le contrôle de cette dernière et pouvons la redéfinir et la redistribuer en direct à nos fans.

Alors beaucoup se diront sûrement que seuls les artistes ayant une énorme notoriété pourront profiter de cette technologie, **mais c’est faux !**

Cette année parmi les artistes qui ont pu tester cette technologie, plusieurs n'avait jamais été signé en maison de disques.

La chanteuse **VERITÈ** a généré **40 k dollars** avec son dernier single en NFT.

L’artiste graphique **beeple** qui ne vivait presque pas de son art vendra une œuvre numérique 69 millions d’euros via une vente aux enchères chez Christie’s.

Alors que vous soyez réticent ou que vous regardiez tout cela de loin est tout à fait normal. C’est toujours le cas lorsqu'une technologie, qui va révolutionner en profondeur nos habitudes, débarque.

C’était aussi le cas avec l’arrivée d’Internet ou la naissance des réseaux sociaux et les premiers à avoir compris ce changement ont souvent été ceux qui en ont tiré avantage.

Personnellement, la dernière fois que je suis resté spectateur face à un tel changement, c’était lors de l’arrivée des cryptomonnaies et précisément du bitcoin. J’y étais comme beaucoup, complètement étranger.

> Mais ceux et celles qui avaient compris ce qui allait se passer sont aujourd’hui millionnaires.

Alors il ne s’agit pas simplement d’un enjeu économique, mais bien de notre indépendance artistique retrouvée.

De notre autonomie tant dans nos choix stratégiques que dans notre capacité à vivre pleinement de notre métier.

title: #2 Les bases et les premières initiatives
body:
Hello tout le monde,

Les choses bougent très vite dans le web3 et il est intéressant de faire un état des lieux des solutions en place et à venir.

Il faut bien rappeler que nous sommes au tout début d’un changement majeur, avant l’adoption de masse de cette technologie.

Alors faisons, de nouveau, un point sur certains principes de bases.

## Qu'est-ce qu'un NFT musical ?

Un NFT musical est en général, la vente d’un fichier source (wav, mp3) en tant que jeton unique, avec, dans le cadre d’une sortie de titre, un nombre limité de token (NFT).

## Qu'obtenez-vous avec un NFT musical ?

En créant son titre en NFT, l'artiste donne la propriété de son contenu et une fois que vous en êtes l’heureux propriétaire, vous pouvez soit conserver ou revendre le NFT. (si ce dernier prend de la valeur par exemple, comme avec une œuvre d’art).

Vous n’obtenez pas les droits d’auteur du contenu, sauf que certains artistes commencent déjà à intégrer une notion de "redevances" attachée au NFT. (vous touchez un % des ventes du streaming du titre)

Exemple avec la dernière sortie du rappeur **Nas** sur le site **[Royal](https://royal.io/editions/Nas-Rare)**

Le NFT peut aussi inclure des tickets de concert, du merchandising ou un accès à un réseau de communication privé (l'accès à un **Discord** par exemple**)**.

L'acquisition du NFT permet donc, en plus de supporter un artiste que vous aimez, de faire partie intégrante du projet, en ayant même un intéressement.

**Ce que ça change par rapport au modèle actuel (Streaming) ?**

Comparé au modèle de **Spotify**, selon lequel une chanson vaut ce que les royalties disent qu'elle vaut, c'est l'artiste qui définit ses propres conditions et les auditeurs qui valorisent directement le prix du NFT.

—-

Maintenant ces quelques règles évoquées, faisons un tour des solutions en cours de développement, spécialement dédiées musique.

**Ps :** Dans cette liste, je ne citerais pas les market place types Opensea, Rarible, Mintable etc qui intègrent des NFTS musicaux, mais qui ne sont pas dédiés aux NFT musicaux.

## Pour la création

**[Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/)** est une des premières plateformes de création de NFT musicaux 1/1. Les musiciens peuvent diffuser leurs chansons en tant que NFT 1/1 directement auprès des collectionneurs. Encore en beta et non ouvert à tous.

**[Sound](https://www.sound.xyz/)** permet, de créer des NFT musicaux et permet de créer des opportunités d'engagement exclusives. Non ouvert à tous.

**[Zora](https://zora.co/)** n'est pas exclusif aux NFTs de musique, mais en embarque beaucoup. Non ouvert à tous.

**[MintSongs](https://www.mintsongs.com/)** permet de vendre ses titres en NFT. Solution encore en beta, mais ouverte à tous.

**[Async Art](https://async.art/music?tags=notable)** est une plateforme de création de NFT d’art, mais aussi de NFT musicaux.

**[Royal](https://royal.io/)** lancé par l’artiste **3Lau**, un des premiers artistes à avoir sorti des NFT musicaux. Sa plateforme est encore en beta et s’adresse pour le moment aux très gros artistes.

## DAO de musiciens

« Le terme DAO signifie “decentralized autonomous organization” (organisation autonome décentralisée en français) et peut être décrit comme un protocole blockchain open-source régi par un ensemble de règles, créées par ses membres élus, qui exécutent automatiquement certaines actions sans avoir besoin d’intermédiaires.

Les règles de la DAO sont intégrées dans un code informatique (Smart Contract), qui s’exécute de lui-même en fonction du comportement du protocole. Il n’est pas nécessaire d’interpréter ces règles de programme, car elles sont automatiquement mises en œuvre lorsque les conditions spécifiées se produisent. »

Les DAO sont donc des écosystèmes au sein de la blockchain ou un musicien peut donc monnayer ses NFTs de musique dans une trésorerie DAO et décentraliser la propriété de son contenu parmi sa communauté via des NFTs et des jetons sociaux.

**[Mirror](https://mirror.xyz/)** permet aux musiciens de créer des DAO pour leur projet d’artiste, de sortie d’album, d’EP ou de single, etc. 

**[Juicybox](https://juicebox.money/#/)** est une autre solution opensource qui permet de monter votre DAO..

## Communautés

**[Songcamp band](https://discord.com/invite/wHsJD2sTpc)**, est la première DAO crypto x music. C’est une communauté de créateurs de musique permettant aux musiciens de se réunir et de créer des NFTs musicaux. Vous accédez à la communauté via leur Discord

**[Water & Music](https://stream.waterandmusic.com/)** est une communauté de recherche et d'écriture sur l'avenir de la musique dirigée par Cherie Hu. Ils ont lancé également leur DAO et leur jeton de recherche $STREAM.

**[Good Karma Records](https://twitter.com/goodkarmadao)** est le premier label de musique cryptographique créé par Grady, un artiste majeur de Music NFT, pour soutenir les musiciens du web3.

## Curation

**[Yup](https://yup.io/)** est un protocole de « curation » selon lequel les utilisateurs peuvent évaluer n'importe quel NFT et suivant les interactions gagnent des $YUP. Le propriétaire du NFT de son côté, gagne également une partie des récompenses $YUP.

## Production

**[Arpeggi](https://www.arpeggi.io/studio)** est un outil de production de NFT musical. Un DAW (logiciel de production musicale) qui est accessible dans le cloud, directement de votre navigateur et qui permet, une fois votre titre terminé, de le déployer (minter) directement sur la blockchain.

title: What Are Gamefied NFTs & Why Do They Matter In The Metaverse?
body:
**Introduction to the "meta:verses”**

The Metaverse according to me are interactive & immersive extensions of the Internet, that will be defined & differentiated by the "game:fied" mechanisms behind them. I prefer to call it meta:verses as I believe that, just like the "websites of the internet", "galaxies/planets of the universe", the metaverse is going to be based on 'verses' that will have different functions/mechanisms & use cases.

Gamefied NFTs: AKA “Artistic Arcade Metaverses”, a concept derived/coined by me as an indie game dev & an amateur generative artist which involves "crafting imaginary AI play into art pieces blended with interactive arcade inspired by classic retros or hyper-casual games that will be built & hosted alongside dynamic mechanisms on the blockchain" & just like single pages of the web, these are simple/single or non-fungible verses of the metaverse.

As the NFT community evolves: we see different forms of creations, scaling from 1/1 arts to PFPs, from music NFTs to photography & a lot more; but the concept of having NFTs as games might seem new but will be understandable by a lot of people if exposed & will help create a fun filled community as challenges could be created by individuals or teams as I call it; a league of "non-fungible gamers" & unlike casual NFTs, these will be multiple editions based or ERC1155 because they are meant to be played by 'people'.

The concept of gamefied NFTs is both exclusive & inclusive, as all games are hosted on multiple servers like IPFS or itch.io, and these will provide links alongside these crafts that makes it shareable by exclusive owners to non-owners to make it inclusive unlike other NFTs. With these, a lot of indie game devs will be able to hop into the NFT scene as a whole new community of creatives, presently we see a lot of passionate indie game devs running down the drain or struggling to be recognized, as they are not given actual opportunities to expose their cranky creations because big game studios are dominating the scene, but with decentralization & the rise of gamefied NFTs, they'd be able to create exclusive games for the community & with that keep the passion alive. And these way game lovers who would like to play or replay some of these classics are given an opportunity.

In the blockchain: These could also be used as a medium of token creation, using the $ASH ecosystem & mechanism as an example which Pak tagged "a token of creation through destruction" where art pieces released under the ecosystem can be directly burned & used to create new tokens which are directly distributed to the owners/burners as a reward unlike the actual burning system across blockchains. This I site as the second phase of my crafts that I tagged "Gamefied Fungibility & Interoperability" this is the part where all gamefied NFTs are merged & can be achieved by either creating an AI blockchain protocol or actual AI blockchain that will power these creations; For (1) Fungibility: Just like $ASH, thousands/millions of gamefied NFTs built by creative devs will be directly burned by owners after playing, as a decentralized means of mining new fungible/social tokens & in return acts as a reward for playing, more like a little 'Play2Earn' games. This will be valued & dynamically balanced by the AI system & by the community using it. This will also serve as a medium of ‘burning’ NFTs & earn an arcade game as a reward… For (2) Interoperability: With an AI system that has the ability to communicate with multi-chains, interoperable transactions will be carried out with a little fee, moving NFTs from one chain to the other will be made easy and will also trigger the minting of new gamefied NFTs to the wallet of the person who carries out this transaction.

In the actual immersive metaverse: gamefied NFTs will become gem-like collectible mini-games, having read/watched things like "ready player one" where we see many mini games coming into play as a form of quest or just a fun play & some actually involving the authors of the OASIS, we could state an example to say to access a certain weapon you must complete this mini game,

or just function as a sort of collectible to boast of like pokemon cards but played in a 2d virtual screen built within these 3d immersive worlds. We could have thousands of it placed across different part of "meta:verses" as actual arcade machines but will be more artistic as against the "retro times" where coins were inserted to play but here crypto(s) will be inserted to access these.

“The metaverse” just like I stated earlier wouldn't be just immersive worlds, as we are already seeing mechanisms that will be super important in the metaverse, why others are waiting for a single immersive 3D MMORPG as a metaverse, the mechanisms are being put into play, like Pak's "merge/mass" this I believe is an actual metaverse of mechanism that is "play/game" based. Then the metaverse/meta:verses will be gradually scaled to virtual worlds of fantasies, stories, or just fun based immersive extensions of the internet.

Let's build the metaverse bit by bit: "one verse at a time"!

title: #3 "A change is gonna come"
body:
Hello à toutes et à tous ;)

Chez **[Spread The word](https://www.spreadtheword.fr/)**, on est 5 artistes, on fait de la musique depuis + de 20 ans et on a toujours, de manière consciente ou inconsciente réfléchi ardemment à notre métier de musiciens.

On voulait comprendre et maîtriser les règles du game.

> Et depuis le début, on est plutôt très disciplinés.

On nous a expliqué comment il fallait produire, puis s'autoproduire, “cliper”, se promouvoir et quelles armes on devait utiliser.

À l'arrivée la balance investissement/bénéfices a toujours nettement penché d'un seul et même côté.

Mais par moment, nous avons connu l'ivresse, suffisamment pour continuer à croire au système.

**Mais 20 ans après qu'en est-il vraiment ?**

La réalité, c'est que ce modèle est incapable de faire vivre les principaux acteurs, à savoir les artistes !

Que la technologie est exclusivement au service d'intermédiaires que sont les distributeurs, les plateformes de streaming et les Majors.

Et il suffit de contempler ses reversements streaming chaque mois, pour en avoir la certitude.

## L'HEURE EST AU CHANGEMENT

Alors quand on a entendu parler d'une technologie qui avait pour ambition de supprimer tout intermédiaire et redonner le pouvoir aux créateurs, on s'y est forcément intéressés.

### LA BLOCKCHAIN

Très vite, on a compris les énormes possibilités, la grande simplicité des échanges et le retour du bon sens.

### RÉCUPÉRER LA PROPRIÉTÉ DE NOS CONTENUS

Lorsque vous utilisez Instagram par exemple pour publier vos contenus, vous venez nourrir un écosystème qui prospère sur votre data.

À aucun moment, vous n'êtes récompensés ! Pire, votre contenu ne vous appartient même pas.

Et c'est le cas de tous les réseaux sociaux.

### DÉFINIR LE PRIX DE NOTRE MUSIQUE

Ce droit si élémentaire nous a totalement été retiré sans aucune consultation.

Sous prétexte d'une technologie, certes incroyable, il a été décidé d'un commun accord que notre musique valait 1,29 € en téléchargement et enfin 0,00xx€ par écoute.

### RÉCOMPENSER SES FANS

Avec l'arrivée du crowdfunding, ou plus récemment des communautés payantes, type **[Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/)**, fans et artistes ont pu créer des écosystèmes fermés, viables pour l'artiste et valorisants pour les fans.

Ce qui va se passer avec les sorties de titres en NFT est finalement un prolongement de ces modèles collaboratifs, mais avec en plus une notion d'intéressements et de royalties pour les fans.

Ces derniers auront non seulement la satisfaction de participer au développement de leur artiste préféré, mais ils auront aussi un intérêt direct à sa réussite.

## LES NFTS

"NFT", c'est le mot dans toutes les bouches en ce moment !

Pourtant, nous ne sommes qu'au début de cette révolution. Nous sommes presque en avance ou “early” comme disent les Anglais.

En effet, 0,2 % de la population mondiale aurait déjà acheté un NFT.

On ne peut pas dire, à ce jour, que ce soit totalement main stream.

Et on sait qu'une technologie met du temps à s'installer dans notre quotidien, mais on sait aussi que les historiques, les early, ont toujours été ceux qui ont pu tirer profit de ces révolutions.

Quand la masse va s'y intéresser, la demande surpassera l'offre, donnant inévitablement de la valeur aux collections historiques.

## L'HEURE DE LA MUTATION

Nous nous sommes donc jetés corps et âme dans cette transition et travaillons déjà sur des solutions qui puissent concrètement aider les artistes indépendants.

La suite très rapidement :)

title: Canto Launch Sequence
body:
As the Canto launch approaches, the development team has prepared a timeline for the Canto community. The sequence will begin with Settlers of Canto, a dress rehearsal for the Canto launch, followed by protocol activations, and Canto’s inaugural liquidity mining program.

### July 16th, 11AM CT: Settlers of Canto

Starting at 11AM CT, we will open up our testnet for interested users to get early access to Canto.

For access, please head to [settlers.canto.io](http://settlers.canto.io/) and enter the necessary information. By Saturday at 11AM, you will have received test tokens in your wallet to use on the testnet. We appreciate your support. 
  
 **Update: The team is currently working on some issues that were identified on testnet. We'll announce an updated launch schedule when the issues have been addressed.**

### TBA: Pre-liquidity mining activations

**Canto GovShuttle** - A smart contract system for Layer-1 governance to enact its policy decisions in the execution layer.

**Bridging** - The bridge interface will go live. Users can deposit ETH, USDC, and USDT from mainnet via Gravity Bridge. ATOM transfers will be possible via IBC.

**Canto Decentralized Exchange** - A DEX with 0% LP fees for stable and volatile pairs, based on Solidly trading logic.

**Canto Lending Market** - A lending market for assets on Canto including LP tokens based on Compound V2 lending logic.

**NOTE and supporting smart contracts** - [NOTE is Canto’s unit of account token](https://mirror.xyz/0x4CeD9817cAD891aEFfbF5Fb7DcB6f3c6aEBd4228/DmiUSBdAED7ouIwvDZptFAM1XzpDNEKCF-GBuMDwWa8).

### TBA: LM Program Starts

At 11AM CT on July 20th, Canto’s liquidity mining program will kick off. To participate in the liquidity mining, head to [lp.canto.io](http://lp.canto.io/) and provide liquidity to the DEX.

**Canto will launch with 5 incentivized pools:**

* USDC/NOTE Concentrated Liquidity Pool (yx^3 + xy^3 = k)
* USDT/NOTE Concentrated Liquidity Pool (yx^3 + xy^3 = k)
* NOTE/CANTO Full Range Liquidity (xy = k)
* CANTO/ETH Full Range Liquidity (xy = k)
* CANTO/ATOM Full Range Liquidity (xy = k)

After receiving LP tokens, participants can earn rewards by supplying the LP tokens to the Canto Lending Market. Rewards will be distributed in the form of Canto dripped to the LP token suppliers.

**Canto is a high risk experiment that is testing a series of new ideas on the frontier of decentralized finance and social coordination. Please participate at your own discretion.**

### About Canto

Canto is a Layer-1 blockchain built to deliver on the promise of DeFi – that through a post-traditional financial movement, new systems will be made accessible, transparent, decentralized, and free. Created by a loosely organized collective of chain-native builders, Canto is a new commons powered by Free Public Infrastructure.

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory to remember, nor the processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which “you” obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon accessing reality for the first time, “you” are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, become aware of “your” existence (‘consciousness’), as well as develop an awareness of ‘thoughts’ and a procedure of thoughts (‘thinking’), achieve (some level of) control of your body and thinking (agency), and eventually learn from the environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’), which we store in our ‘memory’. The connections are a model that describes a functional i/o relation between bits (‘understanding’). Putting this all together, “we” exist as a conscious, intelligent agent of reality perceiving a sequence of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. It is almost as if reality is a Turing-Complete system (a BIG assumption) and our brains are a Turing Machine (another BIG assumption). The one thing missing in the Turing analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. The brain (our “interpretation engine”) is unique and not well understood. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it later.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their experiences and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events that we did not personally observe (and even when we do have an experience … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, motivation, feelings, emotions, and biology) of which we may not be aware in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). Perspective is gained with an account of bias. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![A crude example of well-intentioned (perhaps) yet biased hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2dSC4WSKaPSXEgp5J1L9A.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise\*\*\*, not truth-seeking. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![Infinitism  -- The Ultimate Burden Of Proof -- aka The Absence of Evidence vs. Evidence of Absence Fallacy](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other (and from that moment of history … not viewed as a “Bayesian” from the future) and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and present-day graphical renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. The evidence simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later “discovers” them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![The Gettier Problem (philosophy), Gödel’s Incompleteness Theorems (math), and Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle (science) all arrive at the same idea from different disciplines -- proof requires complete information and infinite precision. Conjecture is imminent (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt" in court.)](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. A thorough assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that everything can be explained, so the world must be deterministic. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series with Brett Hall breaking down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to have ‘creativity’ -- an ability to create new “things”. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are **[First Principles](https://fs.blog/first-principles/#_ftn11)** -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> *“What I cannot create, I do not understand”*
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe the *Unseen*:

(1.) things that do not exist in the present moment and are of the past or future. For example, we can imagine hypotheticals.

(2.) things which are not apparent to the senses, thus not observable. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. Unobservable phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment.

An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely answers “How?”. An explanation is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, why something happened, or why something will happen, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root. Try the **5 Why’s method** to improve the accuracy of an explanation.

> *“Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.”*
>
> — Carl Sagan

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Again, a partially true, incomplete explanation can be sufficient if we only care about a certain level of accuracy. An explanation is measured by its explanatory power -- the degree to which an explanation accomplishes an objective. The objective can be (and usually is) to accurately describe or predict reality. Explanations have degrees of completeness based on the amount of information present in them\*\*\*\*. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. A complete explanation leaves nothing to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and 100% accurate. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is Truth (with a capital ‘T’). This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as Truth (see [epistemic regress](https://www.informationphilosopher.com/knowledge/infinite_regress.html)). One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with Truth and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation accurately describes a fundamental Truth (a “law” of nature\*\*\*\*\*) because there is always a chance that we discover new information debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy and significance. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is simply an iterative assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *non-observables*, in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). There will always be unknowns and we do not know the significance of the unknowns. The highly significant non-observables are The Black Swans. We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retrospectively describe causation and also make reasonable predictions → which builds information and iterates knowledge → which inspires imagination → which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! Regardless of whether or not information is infinite\*\*\*\*\*\*, knowledge is not scarce. It is the product of intelligence and unbounded imagination and is stored in memory.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It is Truth. It just is\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. It is the purest form of objectivity (no interpretation necessary). Frankly, reality does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this realization is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we are an agent of change capable of effecting our own lives. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- uncertainty attributed to an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one theoretical exception. The only proposed natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability of the probability distribution of subatomic particles in spacetime. This gets more interesting if you consider quantum randomness in a multiplicative series of moments. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the Truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing knowledge gaps (not to be confused with information gaps). Here are two ways to reduce knowledge gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- inducing a hypothesis from experience.

2\.) explanatory methods -- deducing a cause and effect relation from imagination.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem.

Empirical methods infer an independent factor (causal inference) from observations or experimental results (statistics). This is useful to identify information gaps. You can gain (uncover) information by changing the conditions (i.e. varying the independent variable to see the change in the dependent variable). Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you may getting closer to a causal relationship (though there still may be ‘Hidden’ variables\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* which are the actual root cause). However, correlation is not causation\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* …. so … how do you know if the measured response in the ‘effect variable’ was the result of varying the ‘cause variable’ or if the independent factors are truly independent themselves? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Explanations describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’ -- information not represented in the statistics -- and can implicate an unknown factor as the root cause. The reasoning offered in an explanation is based in ‘possibility’ as opposed to ‘probability’ (though probability can also appear in an incomplete explanation). When something is deemed ‘unexplainable’, this indicates either a severe information gap or a lapse in imagination.

I suggest watching Vsauce's YouTube video: "[What is Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)" and Veritasium’s sister episode: "[What is Not Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)" to further explore randomness as a property of ignorance.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)

To quickly make better predictions, acquire fundamental knowledge. Search for the fundamental factors of reality, the ones with high explanatory power. Lean on *First Principles* thinking or even better -- [Zeroth-Principles Thinking](https://medium.com/future-literacy/zeroth-principles-thinking-9376d0b7e7f5). After all, explanations are the best way to hunt the Truth. On the other hand, we will always have to make decisions with incomplete information, and thus are exposed to uncertainty … so get used to it!

I glossed over the fact that “meaning” is an important part of the brain’s interpretation engine. Sooo … what is meaning? Is meaning created or intrinsic to reality? If we assume that reality is deterministic, then can meaning exist or can we have free will? Can there be a meaning of life? If we assume that life has meaning, then what is the meaning? My best answer right now: the meaning of life is to create value. More on that in the next post…

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*I assume ownership of consciousness for the sake of understanding; rather, consciousness spontaneously “exists” without an agent or precise initial moment and is “you”. I enjoyed Brett Hall’s view of [ontology](https://www.bretthall.org/blog) --an explanation of being--what does it mean to exist. The model that I describe requires a definition for the concept of “you” (a whole exercise itself). I use a version of “you” that is a figment of the brain and represents an identity. “You” is awareness that exists as a state of consciousness. I also enjoyed Evan Conrad’s [article](https://evanjconrad.com/posts/how-to-feel-good) which offers a view that “you” are not your “thoughts” and suggests practical applications of this knowledge. “You” observe thoughts. At the same time, you have agency of thinking in the sense that you may be aware of a thought or feelings and its relation to “you” (as an identity that has control of an interpretation engine which does thinking procedures and serves the next thought). I would like to add that you are not your feelings. In Conrad’s view, both thoughts and feelings are real “to” you, rather than “are” or “of” you.

\*\*Yes, trust in fellow humans is risky, but the payoffs have historically outweighed the costs. There are concepts of infinite games in Game Theory which incentivize cooperation in most instances.

\*\*\*We will explore the mechanisms of consensus in another post.

\*\*\*\*Completeness is a function of access and precision. Explanations are incomplete when they are missing info. This is almost always the case when expressing explanations in spoken language because language itself is imprecise. A good question: can we know all information?

\*\*\*\*\* When describing physical reality, there is no such thing as a “law of nature” or Truth (with a capital ‘T’) since the description exists in the abstract realm of knowledge. There are just REALLY good explanations (called theories in science) that may resemble physical Truth because of their accuracy in describing and predicting phenomena, but we would never know for certain. However, there is a Truth. It exists and exists as reality. This implies the existence of False (with a capital ‘F’). Knowledge is abstract thought -- an interpretation of information which exists relative to reality (Truth/False) -- and can actually be True or False when describing knowledge, but not reality.

\*\*\*\*\*\*The more important and deeper question is whether reality is continuous or discrete. This question is most famously illustrated via [Zeno’s Paradox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zeno%27s_paradoxes). Modern science does not even have a consensus on this answer. I think the answer requires a better understanding of time and information. Is information a property of reality? Does reality exist as a state of information at (that changes changes between?) moments of time? Can we create new “things” (real or abstract)? Does the set of information (as elements) grow, accumulate, remain static, or simply change?

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*I suppose the ultimate truth is whether reality itself exists or not.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*We may explore whether the inverse is necessarily true, which requires a consideration of infinity. What happens when you consider time (the temporal relationship between cause and effect)? The most convincing concept of time that I can understand is that time represents a relation between moments of reality. In this concept, a moment is a state of information (reality) and time is the relation of moments -- The God Equation -- rather than the moment. Therefore, there are instances of information, rather than instances of time. Time describes change. It *is* change. If time is a relation mapping a state of info to another state of info, which [type](https://t-redactyl.io/blog/2021/03/types-of-functions-injective-surjective-and-bijective.html) of relation is it?

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*We may address these concepts at some point. We perceive time as a sequence of moments (maybe a series when considering our memory), but time may not actually “be” an ordered sequence of moments. We do not have access to all of reality (information), which leads to gaps in information and knowledge (understanding). Also, knowledge lags information. The Truth Spectrum is not to be confused with true vs. false in logic. It is more closely related to the concept of [entropy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entropy_(information_theory)) in Information Theory.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* Any statistical model can attempt to predict reality. Some models are capable of making accurate predictions (though maybe not significant). Yet, any model trying to predict reality assumes a complete and closed system. We can use a model to make inferences about things not in the data, but non-observables belong to the realm of possibility (unknown unknowns), not probability (known unknowns). A change in the dependent variable (effect) may be caused by an unaccounted or unknown factor (cause) rather than the independent factor. This may be “confounding'“ to some. Others say Hidden variables, once identified in an experiment, are “extraneous” if they think they can be controlled. It is hard to control variables (especially unknown ones) in experiments, and physical experiments are temporal in nature.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*Correlation is an association between sets, not a function. Causality is a function of sorts.

PS: I promise future blogs will not be this long.

title: #4 Penser par soi-même et si possible, en dehors du cadre!
body:
NFTs, blockchain, cryptos, sont des mots que peu de gens connaissaient il y a encore 5 ans.

Les premiers NFTs ont vu le jour en 2017, mais c’est surtout pendant la crise du covid, en 2020, qu’une plus grande partie du public s’y intéresse.

Et en l’espace de 2 années, seulement, on a déjà connu une période incroyablement faste appelée le “bull market” et un marché fortement baissier, dans lequel nous sommes actuellement, appelé le “bear market” !

Pourtant, le NFT et son utilité restent encore très méconnus en France, à en croire un sondage de l’Ifop datant de février 2022 :

> “Seul 1 Français sur 10 sait de quoi il s’agit précisément. Ce sont les plus jeunes qui sont davantage réceptifs à ce genre d’actifs. En effet, 40 % des 18-34 ans qui connaissent les cryptoactifs ont investi ou comptent le faire. Et 49 % des 18-24 ans pourraient acheter un objet numérique sous forme de NFT. Les personnes de plus de 65 ans sont seulement 8 % à l’envisager.”

### Supprimer certaines croyances

La plus grande difficulté lorsqu’on parle de NFT, c’est qu’il existe des croyances vieilles de + de 30 ans, depuis la naissance d’Internet en fait.

La majeur partie d’entre nous a accepté l’idée qu’un fichier numérique ne pouvait être unique, avoir de propriétaire et encore moins de valeur propre.

**Le copier/coller était déjà une démonstration incontestable !**

Mais c’est surtout l'innovation du torrenting via le partage de fichiers peer-to-peer (Napster) qui a été un changement de paradigme que les gens ont accueilli, il est vrai avec enthousiasme.

D’un coup, il était possible d'accéder à toute la musique, gratuitement et de son ordi.

Cela a fondamentalement changé la façon dont notre culture évalue la musique et cimenté l'idée que la musique devrait être gratuite ou presque.

### Les plateformes de streaming, en “faux” sauveur

L'industrie de la musique a alors décidé de récupérer une grande partie de l'immense valeur perdue par des plates-formes comme Napster et The Pirate Bay pour créer une offre de streaming.

Mais leur modèle de rémunération est tel qu'un artiste gagne très peu d'argent sans une base de fans massive.

90 % des albums ne reçoivent que 1 % des flux. **Et 98,6 % des artistes de Spotify ne gagnent que 36 dollars par trimestre.**

**Kay Hanley**, chef d'orchestre et cofondatrice du groupe **Songwriters of North America**, a écrit sur Variety : "C'est maintenant notre chance de saisir l'énergie d'un moment latéral et de la réorienter pour parler du vrai problème : le modèle constant d'exploitation, de dévaluation et de manque de respect des créateurs de musique de Spotify."

#### Capitalistes et créateurs

La relation entre les capitalistes et les créateurs a toujours été tendue.

En tant qu'institution, l'industrie de la musique s'est rarement occupée de ceux qui créent la plus grande partie de sa valeur : ***les artistes***.

“Les mauvais contrats et les fausses promesses ont fait pencher la balance en faveur des intérêts des entreprises et la présence de quelques superstars masque l'impact de la vérité : **très peu de musiciens peuvent vivre de leur art.” © MacEygon**

### Imaginer un nouveau modèle

De tout temps, les révolutions sont donc intervenues lorsque certaines personnes ont décidé de penser différemment, de sortir du cadre ou de casser les codes.

Et ces révolutions dépendent de la vision finalement d’un petit groupe d’humains. 

> “Les Métiers à tisser n’ont pas vu venir la machine à vapeur, ou **Encyclopedia britannica** n’a pas vu venir **Wikipedia** ! Une seule invention est c’est la révolution industrielle.” - Lip dans la série culte [Shameless ](https://www.allocine.fr/series/ficheserie_gen_cserie=7634.html)👈 😀

Le modèle en place est-il juste ?

Et si une oeuvre digitale pouvait être unique ?

Avoir, de nouveau, une valeur !

Votre dernier single, doit-il forcément valoir 0,0033ct€ par écoute ?

#### Un modèle centré sur l’artiste et le fan

Ce changement a déjà commencé avec l’arrivée de plateformes alternatives comme **[Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/)** ou **Kickstarter**.

Le fan est impliqué à un niveau plus important dans le projet de l’artiste et reçoit des contre-parties en échange d’un financement participatif.

**Et avec les NFTs, la relation artiste/fan va encore plus loin.**

En achetant un NFT, ils achètent un actif de l’artiste, qui peut prendre de la valeur (pour l’artiste\* et pour le fan) ; le succès devient dès lors, **relationnel**.

\*chaque NFT comprend généralement une part du créateur - un pourcentage qui revient à l'artiste chaque fois que le NFT est revendu - lui permettant de gagner de l'argent pour toujours.

La blockchain se charge de valider et d’automatiser ces transactions, éliminant ainsi, certains intermédiaires et les problématiques de "mauvais contrats" ou de "fausses promesses".

#### Une réglementation qui ne suit pas encore

Avant que les NFTs n'entrent dans la danse, la propriété de la musique était déjà complexe : chaque enregistrement sonore est protégé par de multiples droits d'auteur, et chaque utilisation distincte :

* Jouer une chanson
* En faire une copie
* La diffuser
* La jouer en synchronisation avec un contenu visuel

Il faut maintenant ajouter à cela le cadre de “ténu de la propriété numérique”, car la propriété juridique d'un fichier numérique n'existe pas à ce jour.


---

## Conclusion

Apporter le web3 dans l’industrie musicale, c’est voir les artistes reprendre le pouvoir sur leur art, sur leurs flux de revenus avec la possibilité de les partager avec leurs consommateurs/fans s’ils le souhaitent.

C’est aussi voir les fans devenir des fans **actifs**.

Depuis juin 2020, plus de 1,6 million de NFT musicaux ont été vendus, générant un chiffre d'affaires d'environ 100 millions de dollars.

Le changement est donc déjà en marche, mais la route est encore longue pour que les acteurs majeurs de cette industrie acceptent de revoir ce qui leur paraissaient comme acquis.

title: StarNode更新教程
body:
运行StarNode主要是使用PathFinder 

[https://github.com/eqlabs/pathfinder](https://github.com/eqlabs/pathfinder)

 是源码进行下载编译后，使用编译生成的文件运行。

所以要更新时 ，应更新源码，进行重新编译生成，再执行运行

## 操作步骤：

* 1. 停止当前pathfinder，使用”ctrl + c”进行停止
* 2.进入pathfinder源码目录，并进行更新

  ```
  // 进入到pathfinder所在目录
  cd pathfinder目录   
  // 查看pathfinder的源码仓库地址
  git remote -v 
  ```

![git status查看当前源码版本；git remote -v查看源码仓库地址](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PtUGOatrDmuXKotpZpFTM.png?height=190&width=956)

* 3.获取新的源码，切换到最新版本

  ```
  // 获取新的源码
  git pull
  // 切换到当前最新的代码版本
  // 最新的代码版本可以通过仓库地址查看，如下图在Release下是最新代码版本
  git checkout 最新代码版本
  // 示例：git checkout v0.2.5-alpha
  ```

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qmqi9ZfJl6T5eSssFf_xY.png?height=1800&width=3204)

* 更新依赖（因为当前教程只是讲解更新，所以假设Ruse、Python已经安装完成）

  ```
  // 进入pathfinder下的py目录
  cd py
  // 激活python虚拟环境
  source .venv/bin/activate
  // 更新PIP，通常不需要
  PIP_REQUIRE_VIRTUALENV=true pip install --upgrade pip
  // 更新项目的依赖，必须操作（因为可能新版本会有其他代码仓库依赖）
  PIP_REQUIRE_VIRTUALENV=true pip install -r requirements-dev.txt
  ```
* 测试

  ```
  // 进行测试，如下图提示14 passed, 1 skipped，只要没有error都是可以的
  pytest
  ```
* 编译

  ```
  cargo build --release --bin pathfinder
  ```
* 运行
